title: Technical Project Management Guest Lecture, UIC IDS 312

bullets.text: Explored Agile software engineering using ZenHub for sprint planning, issue tracking, and rapid full-stack deployments
Showcased personal projects like a wardrobe logging app, emphasizing user workflows, design principles, working as a team
Delivered as a 30m guest lecture to 50+ students at University of Illinois Chicago in IDS 312: Business Project Management

title: Exploding Chickens Guest Lecture, UIC CS 342

bullets.text: Explored the structure of Exploding Chickens, a full-stack web app built using Node.js, MongoDB with 1,750+ games played
Discussed game play, project milestones, full-stack architecture, data schema, websockets, test coverage, and hosted a live demo
Delivered as a 30-75m guest lecture 3 times to 20-80+ students at University of Illinois Chicago in CS 342: Software Design
